meanings.definition: The action or process of magnifying something.
meanings.sent1: The magnifications in the telescope helped us see the stars clearly.
meanings.sent2: The magnifications on the microscope allowed us to observe tiny organisms.
meanings.sent3: The magnifications in the glasses made everything look huge!
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as a magnifications, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The magnifications of the binoculars brought distant objects closer.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something is magnified.
meanings.sent1: The high magnifications of the camera captured every detail.
meanings.sent2: The magnifications of the map helped us navigate the city.
meanings.sent3: The magnifications of his story made it sound unbelievable!
meanings.sent4: His passion for music was a magnifications of his soul.
meanings.sent5: The magnifications of the painting revealed hidden symbols.

meanings.definition: The act of enlarging the size or scale of something.
meanings.sent1: The magnifications of the image made it easier to see.
meanings.sent2: The magnifications of the building plans showed intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The magnifications of the cake made it look like a giant dessert!
meanings.sent4: His determination was a magnifications of his success.
meanings.sent5: The magnifications of the sound system filled the room with music.
